page.title: 08MARKET DAY AT MORETON
page.content: Moreton with its wide streets has been a{market}town since the Middle Ages. Since the time of Charles I Moreton has had a{charter}to hold a market in the streets. This was a cattle market. Since 1976, when the market rights were bought by the present owners, a market has been held every{Tuesday.} {Trips}to the market are arranged from all over England e.g. Manchester and London. We met visitors from Canada and Australia and also heard that a Australian television crew had been filming the market. The market, one of the{largest one day markets}in the country, has 164 stalls and 111 pitches. About 5000 people attend each week. In our survey we found that there were 46 clothes stalls, 26 household goods stalls and 16 that sell food. Customers, stallholders and shopkeepers think the market is good.
